medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain, located below the umbilicus and eventually in the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began acutely at 2:30 AM. The patient was previously doing well on medication, eating well, and having normal bowel movements until the onset of pain. There was no associated nausea, diarrhea, or fever.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ulcerative colitis (UC), eczema, history of lymphomatoid papulosis as a child (resolved).
